main.name: Zhenjia Chen
main.quote: We are not defined by the chances we do not take or by the opportunities we pass up, rather we are defined by the trials we surmount and by the challenges we overcome.
main.author: Anonymous
main.bio: I am a student at MIT majoring in Computer Science and Engineering. Aside from my academic endeavors, I am passionate about chemistry, energy, and material science. In my limited free time, I enjoy badminton, reading, and equation art.

education.degree: Candidate for B.S. in Computer Science and Engineering
education.description: Coursework: Discrete Mathematics, Machine Learning, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Computer Systems Engineering, Advances in Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Software Construction, Matrix Methods
Graduated valedictorian of my class with an International Baccalaureate diploma and awards in mathematics, chemistry, biology, and history

work.title: Engineering Intern
work.description: As a part of an Agile development team, I designed and extended microservices components for enterprise data security and privacy software by implementing backend features, suggesting more robust API endpoints, and performance testing.  Additionally, my work on slow query monitoring and load testing of the API enabled my team to triage endpoints for further parallelization.  Testing was done with Docker Swarm and Google Kubernetes Engine.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: I collected and analyzed state election data to increase election transparency.  I assisted with data mining election science data and web archiving of relevant state election websites.  My work has contributed to refining the Elections Performance Index, an aggregated indicator and assessment tool for election administration.  I also created data visualizations of state voting patterns and ballots to identify potential instances of election fraud.

work.title: Web Application Developer
work.description: I contributed to the backend of a web application to handle approval of development funding for Accion, a global financial advising non-profit.  The application semi-automated previously manual funding approval process and database updates

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: I conducted experiments, collected, analyzed, and presented data pertaining to aluminum-sulfur batteries. Gained extensive glovebox experience from making both Swagelok and coin cell batteries. Additionally, I suggested potential approaches and strategies to improve battery lifespan and capacity.
